isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 9: LUBRICATING OIL PUMP, OIL FILTER AND COOLER - PRIME THE LUBRICATING SYSTEM

svcproc.title: PREFERRED METHOD
svcproc.para: When the engine has been assembled, it is recommended to lubricate the engine with oil before starting. This is done to prevent any damage to internal parts. The following procedure is the preferred method to use when priming the lubricating system.

warning.para: DO NOT ROTATE ANY DIESEL ENGINE WHEN PRIMING WITH OIL TO PREVENT ENGINE FROM ACCIDENTALLY STARTING.

step1.para: Pressure prime the lubrication system with oil, prior to starting as follows:

step2.para: Inject sufficient oil into the engine to fill the oil filters and charge the entire system.
After priming, check the oil level before the engine is put back into service. Refer to chart for proper oil capacity.
